Atlantic County Justice Facility — Vendors, Contracts, Oversight & Performance (OPRA)

Record purpose

This administrative record preserves Open Public Records Act (OPRA) requests and responses concerning vendor contracting, procurement, oversight, and systems relevant to the Atlantic County Justice Facility (ACJF).

This page is a documentation index. It does not assert findings, legal conclusions, or accusations. Where interpretation is needed, it is kept in a separate notes file.

OPRAmachine Public Record

This request is publicly tracked on OPRAmachine:

  • View this request: Atlantic County OPRA Requests
  • View all requests by filer: X (Devon Tyler of the Barber-Materio Family)

Scope of requests

  • Third-party vendors, contractors, and service providers used at ACJF
  • Contracts, amendments, renewals, scopes of work, monitoring provisions, and termination clauses
  • Procurement records (RFPs/IFBs, evaluations, awards, purchasing method)
  • Performance materials (audits, inspections, deficiency notices, corrective actions)
  • Governance and oversight records (role of Sheriff’s Office and County administration)
  • Systems and modernization records supporting accountability and due-process-related functions

Status

  • OPRA requests prepared for parallel submission to:
    • Atlantic County Sheriff’s Office
    • Atlantic County (General)
    • Atlantic County Improvement Authority (ACIA)

See the timeline below for filing dates, extensions, and productions as they occur.

Timeline

Documents

Requests filed

  • Outgoing request letters, clarifications, fee waiver requests.
  • See: requests/

Agency correspondence

  • Acknowledgements, extensions, delivery issues, portal messages.
  • See: correspondence/

Agency responses

  • Determinations: grants/denials/partial grants, “no records,” fee estimates, redaction explanations.
  • See: responses/

Productions (records received)

  • Responsive records produced by the agency (PDF/CSV/XLSX/images/zips).
  • See: productions/

Notes and analysis boundary

Observational notes (non-findings) are maintained separately at:

  • notes.md

If any document is redacted or withheld, the objective is to preserve the custodian’s stated basis for nondisclosure (including any redaction index) and to request clarification through ordinary administrative channels before escalation.

Precision. Patience. Virtue. Honor.

Citizen accountability through record, dignity, and due process.
